comments.content: Any ideas what is used for Verities mag?

What I know for sure at the moment is they use(d?) [Scotland Italian](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317131408/http:/www.typophile.com/node/107352) by [Haakon Spencer](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317131408/http:/www.haakonspencer.com/) but this one looks a bolder and less 'calligraphy' but overall design looks pretty close.

Ryuk, you mentioned it before here:  
 [http://typophile.com/node/104446](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317131408/http:/typophile.com/node/104446 "http://typophile.com/node/104446")

_The text was typeset and output using the typefaces; Scotland, designed by Haakon Spencer and Lexicon designed by Bram de Does._  
 [http://www.verities.co.uk/images/Verities\_Magazine\_03\_16.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317131408/http:/www.verities.co.uk/images/Verities_Magazine_03_16.jpg "http://www.verities.co.uk/images/Verities\_Magazine\_03\_16.jpg")

Thanks for refreshing my memory and finding the confirmation on the colophon, Akira! I was a bit confused by the apparent boldness which looks different from the previous issues resulting a loss of the 'calligraphy' effect.  
Adding more alternatives: [Metro Nova](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317131408/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/metro-nova), [Gin Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317131408/http:/t-wo.it/2013/06/01/gin-sans), [Value](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317131408/http:/www.colophon-foundry.org/fonts/value)
thanks guys, really appreciate it. Ryuk, I notice you post a lot, do you have any typefaces you've been working on?
